rationale: No equivalent field found in the target schema.
Both 'tissue_id' in the source schema and 'parent_sample_id' in the target schema represent unique IDs of the sample used for the assay.
No equivalent field for assay execution date and time found.
Both fields refer to the protocols.io DOI for describing preparation or assay processes, though the target schema focuses on sample procurement and preparation.
No field in target schema referring to assay operator.
No equivalent field for operator's email.
No matching field for Principal Investigator (PI).
No equivalent field for PI's email.
No clear match for assay categories in the target schema.
Both 'assay_type' and 'dataset_type' refer to the specific type of assay being performed.
Both fields describe the class of analytes being measured.
Both fields describe whether specific molecules are targeted.
Both refer to the vendor of the acquisition instrument.
Both refer to the model of the acquisition instrument.
'ms_source' refers to the ion source used, while 'ms_ionization_technique' refers to the method used for ionization.
Both refer to the polarity of mass analysis.
Both refer to the lower value of the scanned mass range.
Both refer to the higher value of the scanned mass range.
No equivalent field for pixel resolution in X direction.
No matching unit for pixel resolution in X direction.
No equivalent field for pixel resolution in Y direction.
No matching unit for pixel resolution in Y direction.
'preparation_type' describes how the sample was prepared, which is similar to 'matrix_deposition_method'.
Both refer to the vendor of the preparation instrument.
Both refer to the model of the preparation instrument.
Both refer to the matrix used in preparation for mass spectrometry.
Both fields refer to protocols related to preparation.
'overall_protocols_io_doi' refers to the entire assay, while 'analysis_protocol_doi' focuses on data analysis.
Both fields refer to the path for contributor information.
Both fields refer to the path for dataset files.
